vocabulary.definition: circulated rapidly and widely on the internet or through other media.
vocabulary.example: The video of the cute puppy went viral, gaining millions of views in a matter of hours.

vocabulary.definition: a person who is obsessed with a particular hobby or interest, often to the detriment of their social skills.
vocabulary.example: She is a gaming otaku, spending all her free time playing video games.

vocabulary.definition: without prejudice or favoritism; fair and impartial.
vocabulary.example: The journalist presented an unbiased view of the political situation, showing both sides of the argument.

vocabulary.definition: carried out or committed (a harmful, illegal, or immoral action).
vocabulary.example: The crime was perpetrated by a group of individuals working together.

vocabulary.definition: a strong expression of public disapproval or anger.
vocabulary.example: There was a huge outcry from the community against the proposed construction of the new factory.

vocabulary.definition: making an exact copy or reproduction of something.
vocabulary.example: The artist spent hours replicating the famous painting using the same techniques as the original artist.
